interaction_summary:
=== Purchase Information ===
Review Date: 2015/07/23
Average Rating: 4.4
Product Details: {'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Susannah Ward', 'Louise Wardle', 'Gareth Sacala', 'Vicky Matthews', 'Sam Taplin', 'Kasia Uscinska'], 'Producers': ['Susannah Ward', 'Louise Wardle', 'Gareth Sacala', 'Vicky Matthews', 'Sam Taplin', 'Kasia Uscinska', 'Alice Harper', 'Jeremy Dear'], 'Starring': ['Samuel West'], 'Studio': ['PBS']}
Review Text: Although I only watched a couple of the programs that I was most interested in, they were fascinating. I found the London underground  amazing. It is hard to believe that so much is below the surface and actually navigable.
Review Title: Another PBS winner!
Rating: 5.0
--------------------------------------------------
reference_summary:
Yellow Submarine George Dunning (II) (Actor), John Clive (Actor) Rated: G Format: DVD Movies & TV, Music Artists, The Beatles, Feature Films ['Product description', 'Australia released, NTSC/Region 0 DVD: LANGUAGES: English ( Dolby Digital 5.1 ), English ( Mono ), English ( Subtitles ), French ( Subtitles ), WIDESCREEN, SPECIAL FEATURES: Behind the scenes, Booklet, Cast/Crew Interview(s), Commentary, Featurette, Interactive Menu, Remastered, Scene Access, Storyboards, Trailer(s), SYNOPSIS: The Beatles agree to accompany Captain Fred in his Yellow Submarine and go to Pepperland to free it from the music hating Blue Meanies . ...The Beatles - Yellow Submarine', 'Amazon.com', "This restored, animated valentine to the Beatles offers viewers the rare chance to see a work that's been substantially improved by its technical facelift, not just supersized with extra footage. Recognizing that its song-studded soundtrack alone makes", 'Yellow Submarine', 'a video annuity, United Artists has lavished a frame-by-frame refurbishment of the original feature, while replacing its original monaural audio tracks with a meticulously reconstructed stereo mix that actually refines legendary original album versions.', "What emerges is a vivid time capsule of the late '60s and a minor milestone in animation. The music represents the quartet's zenith--", 'Rubber Soul', ',', 'Revolver', ', and', "Sgt. Pepper's Lonely Hearts Club Band", ". The story line, cobbled together by producer Al Brodax and a committee of writers, is a broad, feather-light allegory set in idyllic Pepperland, where the gentle citizens are threatened by the nasty, music-hating Blue Meanies and their surreal arsenal of henchmen, with the Beatles enlisted to thwart the bad guys. Visually, designer Heinz Edelmann mixes the biomorphic squiggles, day-glo palette, and Beardsley-esque portraits of Peter Max with rotoscoped still photographs and film; Edelmann's animated collages also nod to Andy Warhol and Magritte in properly psychedelic fashion, which works wonderfully with such terrific songs.", "High orthodox Beatlemaniacs can still grouse that the animated Fab Four are (literally) flat archetypes, but that's missing the sheer bloom of the music or the giddy, campy fun of the visuals. Making sense of the story is second to submerging blissfully in the sights and sounds of this video treat.", '--Sam Sutherland', 'Additional Features', 'The scope of', 'Yellow Submarine', '\'s 1999 restoration is idealized on the DVD version, which beyond its slightly letterboxed original aspect adds a stunning 5.1 sound mix that showcases the audio team\'s wizardry; music fans can hear the entire score without dialogue, the better to focus on such revelations as "Nowhere Man," boasting a gorgeous, full-stereo chorus, and "Only a Northern Song," with a first-time-ever stereo mix that exploits the full surround array for appropriately mind-blowing effect. Other special features include three storyboarded sequences, two of which are not seen in the final film; behind-the-scenes photos and featurette; a full-length audio commentary; and the original theatrical trailer.', '--Sam Sutherland', 'See more'] {'Aspect Ratio': '1.85:1', 'Is Discontinued By Manufacturer': 'No', 'MPAA rating': 'G (General Audience)', 'Product Dimensions': '5.31 x 7.52 x 0.63 inches; 3.81 Ounces', 'Media Format': 'Animated, Color, Closed-captioned, Dolby, DVD, NTSC, Letterboxed, Widescreen', 'Run time': '1 hour and 25 minutes', 'Release date': 'September 14, 1999', 'Actors': 'George Dunning (II), John Clive, Paul McCartney, Geoffrey Hughes, Ringo Starr', 'Subtitles': 'English', 'Language': 'English (Dolby Digital 5.1)', 'Studio': 'MGM (Video & DVD)', 'Number of discs': '1'} I know this film had lousy reviews but I love the graphics and the music so for me it was a good purchase. My 8 year old granddaughter had a birthday party with under the sea theme so she enjoyed this as well. Not for everyone though. Exactly what I expected and wanted. {'Content advisory': ['Nudity', 'violence', 'alcohol use', 'smoking', 'foul language', 'sexual content'], 'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Daniel Alfredson'], 'Producers': ['Ole Sandberg', 'Peter Nadermann', 'Jon Mankell', 'Anni Faurbye Fernandez', 'Lone Korslund', 'Jenny Gilbertsson', 'Mikael Wallen'], 'Starring': ['Noomi Rapace', 'Michael Nyqvist', 'Lena Endre']} I had seen Girl with the Dragon Tattoo and now this one. There was enough carryover explaining the money and a couple of the original questions were resolved i.e. about her father. There is much more that I believe will be disclosed in the third film and I am eager to see that one. I love Amazon Prime even though the only benefit I get from it is the free films but that alone makes it worth while. Films like this series are what it is all about.

Having seen the first film with sub-titles which left a lot to be desired in being able to read them, I was glad to find the dubbed version. I felt the dubbing was quite well done and made it far more enjoyable. I read some of the reviews and perhaps if I had read the books I might not have enjoyed this as much. I definitely will try to read them as I believe they will flesh this out with other material not shown in the film.

I felt the acting in this, as in the first film, was excellent and Lisbeth is well portrayed. Mikael was a stronger character in the first film but his continued role carries the storyline along. This might actually be better for NOT having read the book as I read that areas were cut out. I personally liked it very much and am eager to see the last film tomorrow night. Powerful storyline Warehouse 13 Science Fiction, Suspense, Drama ["Warehouse 13 returns for its second season, picking up from season one's finale cliff-hanger episode. Season two also features special crossover episodes when Warehouse 13's Allison Scagliotti visits the town of Eureka and Neil Grayston of Eureka visits Warehouse 13."] {'Content advisory': ['Violence', 'smoking', 'foul language', 'sexual content'], 'Audio languages': ['English', 'English [Audio Description]'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Chris Fisher', 'Constantine Makris', 'Tawnia McKiernan', 'Jack Kenny', 'Stephen Surjik', 'Jace Alexander', 'Vincent Misiano', 'Michael W. Watkins', 'Millicent Shelton', 'Michael McMurray'], 'Starring': ['Joanne Kelly', 'Eddie McClintock', 'Saul Rubinek']} This series has an excellent acting team so their interaction works well. It has a nice balance of intrigue and amusement. I am looking forward to seeing more of this series. Very enjoyable {'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Graeme Harper', 'Euros Lyn', 'Jamie Magnus Stone', 'Douglas Mackinnon', 'Rachel Talalay', 'James Strong', 'Charlie Palmer', 'James Hawes', 'Joe Ahearne', 'Toby Haynes'], 'Starring': ['David Tennant', 'David Morrissey', 'Michelle Ryan'], 'Studio': ['BBC America']} I have long been a fan of Dr. Who and it is very frustrating that we don't get it here in HI. At least not on any affordable TV package I have seen. Thank goodness Amazon has it available! It is creative and fun, incongruous and adventurous. Best space fantasy adventure {'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Graeme Harper', 'Euros Lyn', 'Jamie Magnus Stone', 'Douglas Mackinnon', 'Rachel Talalay', 'James Strong', 'Charlie Palmer', 'James Hawes', 'Joe Ahearne', 'Toby Haynes'], 'Producers': ['Steven Moffat', 'Marcus Wilson', 'Sanne Wohlenberg', 'Piers Wenger', 'Beth Willis'], 'Starring': ['Matt Smith', 'Karen Gillan', 'Arthur Darvill']} It is always fun to see where space and time travel will take the Dr. and his companions. The idea of new iterations of the Dr. is what has kept this going for so many years. I used to occasionally get to see the early programs many years ago, and was sad when it was out of production but it certainly has aged as well as the Dr. himselves! More of the best fantasy space adventure {'Content advisory': ['Nudity', 'violence', 'substance use', 'alcohol use', 'smoking', 'foul language', 'sexual content'], 'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Timothy Van Patten', 'Allen Coulter', 'Jeremy Podeswa', 'Ed Bianchi', 'Brad Anderson', 'Alik Sakharov', 'Jake Paltrow', 'Simon Cellan Jones', 'Brian Kirk', 'Martin Scorsese'], 'Producers': ['Rudd Simmons', 'Terence Winter', 'Martin Scorsese', 'Tim Van Patten', 'Stephen Levinson', 'Mark Wahlberg'], 'Starring': ['Steve Buscemi', 'Michael Pitt', 'Kelly Macdonald'], 'Studio': ['HBO']} I am really enjoying this video series, and the only thing I am unhappy about is that more seasons are not available free with Amazon prime. Excellent series – very well done. {'Content advisory': ['Violence', 'substance use', 'smoking', 'foul language'], 'Subtitles': ['None available'], 'Directors': ['Christian Tureaud', 'David Salzberg'], 'Producers': ['Christian Tureaud', 'David Salzberg', 'Mike Boettcher', 'Carlos Boettcher'], 'Starring': ['Mike Boettcher', 'Carlos Boettcher'], 'Studio': ['Anderson Digital']} i just finished watching this film and despite the fact that I hate war and I don't usually watch war films this one was worth the time spent. It was real and I thought it gave the viewer an unabridged sense of the fighting, the heroism, and what those soldiers went through. I happened to read some of the 1* reviews, especially written by veterans, and I must say I didn't have the sense that the correspondents were there to show themselves to be self-aggrandizing. The film showed footage of some terrible battles and there was a strong sense of sadness over those who lost their lives. It was not an easy film to watch, but it was far better than anything Hollywood could come up with. Powerful, poignant, disturbing and very real {'Content advisory': ['Nudity', 'violence', 'substance use', 'alcohol use', 'smoking', 'foul language', 'sexual content'], 'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['John Fawcett', 'David Frazee', 'TJ Scott', 'Brett Sullivan', 'Ken Girotti'], 'Producers': ['John Fawcett', 'David Fortier', 'Ivan Schneeberg', 'Graeme Manson'], 'Starring': ['Tatiana Maslany', 'Jordan Gavaris', 'Maria Doyle Kennedy'], 'Studio': ['BBC America']} The premise of the series is very interesting but what is more interesting is the amazing talent of the actors. Not just Tatiana Maslany Who has done a superb job with the characters, but also Jordan Gavaris. I was sad to learn that season three is not yet included in Amazon prime but I am eagerly waiting to be able to watch the rest of this wonderful series. Amazing talent! {'Content advisory': ['Nudity', 'violence', 'alcohol use', 'smoking', 'foul language', 'sexual content'], 'Audio languages': ['English Dialogue Boost: High', 'English', 'English [Audio Description]', 'English Dialogue Boost: Medium', 'Español', 'Deutsch'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]', 'Deutsch', 'Español'], 'Directors': ['Alex Zakrzewski', 'Ernest R. Dickerson', 'Patrick Cady', 'Aaron Lipstadt', 'Kevin Dowling', 'Adam Davidson', 'Daisy von Scherler Mayer', 'Tim Hunter', 'Christine Moore', 'Zetna Fuentes'], 'Producers': ['Eric Overmyer', 'Michael Connelly', 'Henrik Bastin', 'Mikkel Bondesen', 'Pieter Jan Brugge', 'Jan David Frouman'], 'Starring': ['Titus Welliver', 'Jamie Hector', 'Amy Aquino'], 'Studio': ['Amazon Studios']} A very good, well done series. Looking forward to the next season {'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Susannah Ward', 'Louise Wardle', 'Gareth Sacala', 'Vicky Matthews', 'Sam Taplin', 'Kasia Uscinska'], 'Producers': ['Susannah Ward', 'Louise Wardle', 'Gareth Sacala', 'Vicky Matthews', 'Sam Taplin', 'Kasia Uscinska', 'Alice Harper', 'Jeremy Dear'], 'Starring': ['Samuel West'], 'Studio': ['PBS']} Although I only watched a couple of the programs that I was most interested in, they were fascinating. I found the London underground amazing. It is hard to believe that so much is below the surface and actually navigable. Another PBS winner!
profile:
**Updated User Profile Summary:**

- **Primary Interests:** The user maintains a strong passion for animated films with musical elements, engaging dramas, and intricate storytelling. Their recent interaction indicates an expanding curiosity toward educational and documentary-style content, especially those that explore unique aspects of culture and infrastructure.

- **Entertainment Style:** They appreciate vibrant graphics and imaginative storytelling but are now showcasing a fascination with real-world subjects, such as history and exploration, indicative of their growing desire for informative narratives alongside whimsical adventures.

- **Social Engagement:** The user still enjoys sharing family-friendly media; however, they are increasingly drawn to content that provides insights into complex societal themes. This reflects a shift toward a more intellectual entertainment profile, comfortable with diverse perspectives.

- **Critical Reception Awareness:** While attentive to critical reviews, the user places a premium on personal enjoyment, demonstrating a nuanced appreciation for quality performances in both fictional and factual storytelling.

- **Format Preferences:** They continue to prefer DVD for its bonus content while utilizing streaming services for accessibility, highlighting a flexible approach to content consumption.

- **Rating Behavior:** The user consistently rates films and series highly, with a recent note of admiration for educational programming. This indicates an investment in enriching narratives that stimulate curiosity and learning, reinforcing their evolving taste for multifaceted storytelling. 

This profile underscores the user’s refined taste, blending whimsical storytelling with a newfound interest in insightful, real-world subjects.
